API Timeline

I am perpetually captivated by how APIs have evolved over time. Since I began discussing APIs, I've often heard that their origins predate the timelines I mention in my historical narratives or blog posts. Honestly, if we view "application" as the act of applying a concept or resource, then APIs can be traced back as far as African drumming circles. Every once in a while, I feel compelled to revisit this narrative, and this page reflects what I currently consider to be the API timeline.

Pre-Historic

Drums Are Used to Communicate

Historic

Pigeons Are Used to Send Messages

1753

Charles Morrison Says Electricity Can Transmit Messages

1753

Electrostatic Telegraph

1770

Music box

1775

Electric Telegraph

1790

Barrel Organ

1801

Loom

1804

Electrochemical Telegraph

1805

Barrel Piano

1816

First Working Telegraph

1822

Charles Babbage takes first steps in the construction of machines that would compute numbers

1822

Steam Calculator

1830

Steam Locomotive

1837

Charles Babbage published a paper describing a mechanical computer that is now known as the Analytical Engine

1839

First Commercial Telegraph (Railway)

1842

Punch Tape Player Pianos

1843

Ada Lovelace first describes what is known as a computer and its software

1844

First Long Distance Telegraph Message

1844

Innocenzo Manzetti Modeled Speaking Telegraph

1846

Punch Tape Telegrams

1846

Printing Telegraph

1847

Paper Roll Traveling Valve Reed Organ

1851

Morse Code

1854

Principes of the Telephone

1860

Panetelegraph

1861

First Speech-Transmitting Telephone

1871

Intent to Invent Sound Telegraph

1876

Bell Patents Telephone

1876

Bell sends â€œMr. Watson, come here! I want to see you!â€

1877

First Telephone Exchange in Boston

1877

First long-distance telephone line

1880

1887

1888

Telautograph

1888

Hertz Detects Radio Waves

1890

Punch Cards

Marconi Establishes Radio Link Between England and France

I am also exploring another perspective on this landscape with [my resource timeline to look at API providers by the digital resources they provide](https://apievangelist.com/timeline-resource/). Additionally, I have started studying the early regulation of industries such as railroads, telecommunications, electricity, and radioâ€”[creating a timeline to help me understand how regulation unfolded for these industries](https://apievangelist.com/timeline-industry/), and why we pushed it forward.
